hu.trigary.iodine.api.gui.element

Interface TextureGuiElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttachmentHolder<TextureGuiElement>, DrawPrioritizeable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiClickable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiElement<TextureGuiElement>, GuiHeightSettable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiTooltipable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiTransparentable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiWidthSettable<TextureGuiElement>

    public interface TextureGuiElement
extends GuiElement<TextureGuiElement>, GuiWidthSettable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiHeightSettable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiTooltipable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiClickable<TextureGuiElement>, GuiTransparentable<TextureGuiElement>
    A GUI element that displays a texture and can be clicked. The texture can be from vanilla Minecraft texture or from a resource pack. The default resizing logic is interpolation: the whole texture is rendered, but is magnified or minified. The alternative resizing logic is repeating or cutting: the texture's original size is preserved.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface hu.trigary.iodine.api.gui.element.base.GuiClickable

    • Method Detail

      • getTexture

        @NotNull
 @Contract(pure=true)
@NotNull java.lang.String getTexture()
        Gets the texture's identifier.
        Returns:
        the texture identifier

      • getTextureData

        @NotNull
 @Contract(pure=true)
@NotNull int[] getTextureData()
        Gets the texture file's width, height, the desired texture's X and Y offset inside the file and the desired texture's width and height, in this order. All of these values are 0 by default.
        Returns:
        an array containing exactly the specified values

      • isInterpolating

        @Contract(pure=true)
boolean isInterpolating()
        Gets whether the resizing logic is interpolation or repeat/cut.
        Returns:
        true if the current resizing logic is interpolation, false if it is resizing or cutting

      • setTexture

        @NotNull
default @NotNull TextureGuiElement setTexture(@NotNull
                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String namespacedKey)
        Sets the texture to use. This texture and the file containing it must have the same width and height as this element.
        Parameters:
        namespacedKey - the texture's namespace and location, separated by ':'
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

default @NotNull TextureGuiElement setTexture(@NotNull
                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String namespacedKey,

        Sets the texture to use. This texture and the file containing it must share the same width and height.
        Parameters:

        textureWidth - the texture's and its file's width

        Parameters:

        textureWidth - the texture's width
        textureHeight - the texture's height

        the current instance (for chaining)
